intro: Piper breedlovei, commonly known as the Kauai pepper, is a rare and endemic species native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes various pepper plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in the moist, shaded environments of montane forests. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from invasive species, Piper breedlovei is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
